qas.question: What genre did Zane Grey write in?
Where did Eisenhower learn to play poker?
At West Point, what game did Eisenhower play six nights a week for five months?

context: <a0_0>Angels in the Outfield<a0_0/> was Eisenhower's favorite movie. His favorite reading material for relaxation were the <a2_0>Western<a2_0/> novels of <a1_0>Zane Grey<a1_0/>. With his excellent memory and ability to focus, Eisenhower was skilled at card games. He learned poker, which he called his "favorite indoor sport," in <a3_0>Abilene<a3_0/>. Eisenhower recorded West Point classmates' poker losses for payment after graduation, and later stopped playing because his opponents resented having to pay him. A classmate reported that after learning to play <a4_0>contract bridge<a4_0/> at West Point, Eisenhower played the game six nights a week for five months.
